docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23 -- The International Monetary Fund announced today a new program aimed at solving a major problem of the world's poorer countries: sudden declines in export earnings because of a collapse in the price of such commodities as cocoa...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 23 -- The International Monetary Fund announced today a new program aimed at solving a major problem of the world's poorer countries: sudden declines in export earnings because of a collapse in the price of such commodities as cocoa or sugar or copper.
docs.abstract: IMF, in move to compensate countries for currency loss when prices of raw materials drop, will offer automatic increase in borrowing limits

headline.main: AUTOMATIC LOANS AWAIT POOR LANDS HURT BY PRICE DIPS; Monetary Fund Promises Aid if Commodity Swings Depress Export Profit

docs.snippet: Robert Hamilton returned to Town Hall last night for his first piano recital since his debut, which was not reviewed because of the newspaper strike of 1963. Since then, the 29-yearold Stamford, Conn., pianist has racked up several prizes in con ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Robert Hamilton returned to Town Hall last night for his first piano recital since his debut, which was not reviewed because of the newspaper strike of 1963. Since then, the 29-yearold Stamford, Conn., pianist has racked up several prizes in con tests here and abroad, the most recent being the First International Busoni Piano Competition in Montevideo, Uruguay, last March. His is a highly promising talent.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 28 Argentine nationalists hijacked an airliner at dawn today and forced the pilot to fly 43 passengers and 6 crew members to the desolate Falkland Islands, some 300 miles east of Tierra del Fuego.

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Oct. 1 The housing situation in the developing countries is going from bad to worse and can be improved only through the development of a dynamic and energetic policy, with the United Nations taking a greater role in leadership.
